answers.answer: I am in same boat. But  36 tomorrow and yesterday scan showed she was up to 5.10They grow a lot right now so try not to stress. I go friday for another scan. Probably delivering then.
And i had a previous 36 weeker amd she weighed 6.8

I'm just so worried about her .. since I got discharged today iv not felt her move so when to maternity day unit and they heard her heartbeat fine got to go for a trace tomorrow .. scan and trace on Friday and another scan next week after that I have to be seen 3 times a week .. Just hope my little fight puts the weight on

I have gone through it with my last child and with my current pregnancy. I was told of my pre eclampsia when I was 31 weeks. I am currently 33 weeks now, have went into false labor twice now and we are doing everything we can to keep the baby in till at least 37 weeks, at 37 weeks toy are considered full term, that is why they wait till as close to 37 as possible. Your baby might be small, but it is fully developed and able to live outside the womb at that point. They want the baby out to ensure there is no issues due to the pre eclampsia,which could be more dangerous for the baby then 3 weeks early delivery. My first daughter was fine and I am confident this is the right choice for my son now too. Everything should be fine and the baby should be healthy!
I hope everything is ok with I was induced at 39 weeks with my son because of it.

My first, my daughter was delivered at 34, going on 35 weeks due to preeclampsia. She was born at 3lbs 13ounces. No complications other than a little jaundice, she only needed a two week stay at the NICU and went home a little more than 4lbs. She did great being as little as she was

question: So I have just found out I'm 34+1 and I have pre-eclampsia my poor baby girl is only measuring 3.10, thinking about inducing me at 36 weeks. Just wandering if anyone has been through the same with a small baby and how where they when they where born. I'm so worried about our girl :(
title: Pre-eclampsia
